Sometimes, it's easy to forget how brilliant football can be. In this age of eye-watering wages, executive boxes and corporate sponsorship deals, it's hard not to be cynical about the state of the modern game. 
Luckily, we can always count on football's consistently awesome mascots to remind us why we fell in love with the game in the first place. 
To clarify, when we say 'mascots', we don't mean grown men dressed up in ridiculous outfits. We mean the adorable little kids you regularly see being blown away by the experience of escorting superstar footballers onto the pitch. 
The latest example: the kids you can see chatting to Gerard Pique in the video above, as they wait to walk out with Lionel Messi and the rest of the Barcelona team, ahead of the 1-1 draw at Real Betis. Wide-eyed wonder 
Bless their little cotton socks. Mind you, this isn't the first time we have had respect for the work of some young mascots. These kids all did exceptionally fine work too: Some youngsters simply CANNOT BELIEVE they are walking out alongside Cristiano Ronaldo at Anfield: Liverpool and England captain? You can still get owned by a boy in the tunnel: Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now The same goes for the Sunderland and Ireland captain during the pre-match handshake: Sometimes, a mascot takes his role so seriously that he will coldly shun a rival mascot: Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Occasionally, one clever youngster will make use of his moment of fame… with a carefully planed dab: Being surrounded by your international heroes ahead of a Euro 2016 match can make some kids happier than you possibly imagine… …but that's nothing compared to the hero worship some Swansea fans have for Wayne Rooney: While most mascots are sweet, innocent and positive, some youngsters are refreshingly blunt, like this Leeds lad: And finally, we know this kid wasn't actually a mascot.
